reviews.text: The resturant have happy hours, that includes cocktail/mocktail drinks. They also have happy hours meal with appetizers. The meal was delicious and a decent amount. It's quite fillings. Look out for season special meal, sometimes they have autumn meal like pumpkin curry/soup. The atmosphere is laid-back and chill.
Ordered the Pad See Ew noodles and it was amazing. Waiters check if you‚Äôre okay or need any other service 10/10

I ordered the Pad Thai, and it was easily the best I‚Äôve ever had. I came here for a first date, and the staff were so friendly and welcoming. The cozy atmosphere and charming d√©cor made the evening even better. I also tried the pumpkin soup ‚Äî absolutely delicious! I‚Äôd definitely come back again.
Love this restaurant! Delicious food and great service. Adorable decor.
Amazing Thai food and great vibes! Everything we ordered was delicious, especially the soft shell crab curry. Super busy but totally worth the wait!
Wonderful and freah
The atmosphere is super nice. The lunch special were super yummy and the portion was filling!

Today, I didn't know what restaurant I wanted to eat ‚Ä¶ til I found this one and tried the steamed fish, satay chicken, fresh Oyster, creab fried rice, beef green curry, lemongress sea bass, fried pork belly  and roti massaman. It was a lovely experience from start to finish. Our staff Oaddy, Earn and Nickky so nice and friendly.

My family and I enjoyed a wonderful family dinner!  The atmosphere was warm and inviting, which is perfect for a relaxed evening with my loved ones. The staff ‚Äî  Oaddy, Nicky, and Earn ‚Äî were attentive and friendly, making sure we felt comfortable throughout our visit. The food was also a highlight! Each dish was authentically prepared and full of flavor. My family and o appreciated the variety and quality of the menu, which made it easy to find something for everyone in our group of six.
Great food!

The best restaurant we have been to in a long time!! We ordered two cocktails with Thai twists, the fried pork belly, the lychee curry duck and clay pot rice. We were so impressed by every single dish, they were packed with umami, and the texture of them were amazing too. The food babies we had after finishing everything were soooo worth it! The staff was super kind too! I can‚Äôt recommend this restaurant enough! Best of luck x

Update: we went again on our last day in NYC, we still liked what we got but somehow the dishes were not as good as the first time‚Ä¶ we got crab fried rice, crispy pork belly with basil, summer roll and mango sticky rice.

On weekend nights it‚Äôs better to get reservations, but be prepared for a very loud environment. Weekdays are better and normally you don‚Äôt need a reservation.
My favorite Thai restaurant in NYC. Really fast delivery too.

NYC never runs out of good Thai food, but this cozy little spot really surprised me ‚Äî no line, great prices, and every dish was flavorful.
The soft-shell crab was crispy and juicy, the lime sea bass perfectly tangy + spicy. Green curry ü¶ê is rich and creamy ‚Äî must try! üòç
Highly recommend for lunch specials too.

Amazing experience!
Love that!!
Very solid food and service

üç¥‚ú® Hidden Thai Gem in NYC: Malii Gramercy ‚ú®üç¥
This elegant yet vibrant Thai restaurant is the perfect spot for date nights, dinner with friends, or a cozy solo meal.
Here are my top pick you have to try üëá
ü•• LG Tom Kha Shrimp
The moment it arrived, the aroma was incredible! The coconut broth is rich and creamy with just the right touch of tang and spice. The shrimp are fresh and perfectly tender ‚Äî comforting yet full of flavor.
üçú Pad Thai Boran
A must-order classic! Their version stays true to the traditional Thai recipe ‚Äî the sauce is perfectly balanced between sweet and tangy, the noodles are chewy, and the crushed peanuts and lime bring it all together beautifully. Pure happiness in one bite üí•
ü¶Ä Softshell Crab Karee
Crispy on the outside, tender inside ‚Äî the softshell crab is coated in a mild curry sauce that‚Äôs both sweet and slightly spicy. So flavorful and layered ‚Äî definitely my favorite dish of the night!
üêü Crispy Sea Bass
The sea bass is perfectly fried ‚Äî crisp on the outside, juicy and flaky inside. The tangy-sweet sauce complements it perfectly. Best enjoyed hot and shared with friends!
ü•≠ Mango Sticky Rice
Save room for dessert! The mango is perfectly ripe and sweet, paired with fragrant sticky rice and creamy coconut milk ‚Äî the ultimate tropical comfort bite üå¥
üç∏ Lychee Berry Fizz
A refreshing cocktail that‚Äôs as pretty as it tastes! The mix of lychee and berries is light, fruity, and perfectly balanced ‚Äî an ideal drink to start or end your meal.
üí¨ Overall:
Malii Gramercy is the kind of place you‚Äôll want to come back to. Every dish is made with care, the ambiance feels upscale yet inviting, and the price is totally reasonable. A must-try if you‚Äôre in NYC!
üå∂Ô∏èRating: ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
üìçAddress: 391 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10010

Âú®ËøôÈáåÂêÉËøáÂæàÂ§öÊ¨°‰∫ÜÔºÅÈùûÂ∏∏Â•ΩÂêÉÔºå‰ª∑Ê†ºÈÄÇ‰∏≠ÔºåËøò‰ºöÂÜçÊù•ÔºÅ
Food is very yummy and i love the vibe here!!

Literally tasteless oily slop, don‚Äôt waste your precious money. Like what are these raving reviews talking about? They fooled me, don‚Äôt be like me, lol. I literally couldn‚Äôt eat my Pad see ew it was the nastiest dish I have eaten in a long time - it just tasted like oil literally no flavor just oil üò≠ü§¢ like why
Foods are really authentic! Very cozy restaurant with friendly staffs. Will recommend to friends!
Lovely experience, wonderful service and great food- thank you to our server Earn!
It is a great restaurant with great service!
We had the pad see noodles and it was delicious. The fried basil rice was good too.

Really good taste of food
I love to come here
It‚Äôs nearby our school, so most students come here
It‚Äôs nice for students ü•∞

The steamed sea bass, duck curry and the mango salad were superb

check out the rice that is shaped like the curvature of Marc Andresson‚Äôs head! Saving it for meme material
Great food and great service. The staff is so and kind. I highly recommend the Steamed Sea Bass and any of the salads
i love this place for a quick lunch! really good thai!! and mango sticky rice :p
Tom yum and soft shell crab are so good and very nice staffs. I would visit here again also bring friends!
so much crab meat on the crab fried rice!!! sooo good!!!!
The Lemongrass Sea Bass was SO good‚Ä¶ especially with lime & whatever sauce comes with the crab fried rice‚Ä¶

I always come to Malii Gramercy for the lunch special. It‚Äôs a great price and even better food! Additionally the service and ambiance is unmatched. Very calm and a great time! I would recommend this to anyone I know!
Awesome neighborhood Thai place!
I love the service here. They give best drinks and love the atmosphere.
Best food point

Absolutely loved this place! Every dish was flavorful and well-balanced ‚Äî especially the fried pork belly, tom yum wings, and lychee duck curry. The Thai tea and mango mousse cake were the perfect finish. Cozy atmosphere, friendly service, and great portion sizes. Definitely one of the best Thai spots! üáπüá≠üç¥
Great vibes, food, and staff! I loved the thin noodles for the pad Thai! So yummy :)
The best Thai food in NYC. Great service and quality taste. This restaurant is super authentic and cozy.
Tr√®s irrespectueux avec les livreurs et
The food was great ill say its worth more cost üôÇ‚Äç‚ÜïÔ∏è since this place is near my place ill prob be visiting often
The Food and Service was excellent.
We got the lychee duck and the pad kee Mao. Everything was so delicious and cooked perfectly right. 10/10 recommend if you are in the area. Lovely ambiance too. Would 100% come back again üëçüëç
we ordered the massaman roti, lychee duck curry, and pad kee mao. everything was really flavorful, perfect for a cozy day. would come back again üëç
Amazing service and delicious Lychee Duck!! Always happy to come back here.

Cute place with nice lunch deals and a nice interior! I tried the basil stir fry with pork and it was delicious. I've also never seen a place offer seaweed and tofu soup as an option with the lunch special so that was interesting to try too. The Thai iced tea here is also a solid good Thai iced tea. It's a chill place to have lunch and not too loud inside too, which is great!
Had a very good birthday dinner here in this restaurant and the one who served us (Fah) is super nice!!! Will definitely come again!
Great place! Delicious food and nice service :)
Great service. Great food.  Highly recommend this place. Fah was very friendly and courteous.
all taste goodÔºåperfect lychee lemonade
I really like the lunch menu! ÌåüÏ∫áÌîÑÎùºÏö∞ ÍøÄÎßõ„ÖáÏóêÏö©!!

This was my first time dining at Malii Gramercy restaurant. I was very impressed. The food was amazing delicious. I started with the duck bun, restaurant week menu  (chicken tamarind and tom yam raman) and the softshell crab karee. It was incredibly delicious. The waitress was friendly and the service was great. I love this place and will definitely be back.

Totally recommend the tom yum ramen while the restaurant week is still here! Super delicious!!! The duck and pork belly were a little dry for me - however the sauces save all the dishes, really well-seasoned üî•

The food at Malii was absolutely DELICIOUS!! There were so many items on the menu that I wanted to try, but we settled on the crab fried rice, the lychee duck curry, and the clay pot rice. All the food was so good, and the staff and service were friendly and amazing. Will definitely be back ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Charming and local little spot, with amazing food + drinks-  and great service! The Yuzu Margarita was fab, and the Tom Yum Creamy soup was probably one of the best I‚Äôve had. My friends and I loved it.
Tom Khao with flat rice noodles were amazing. The layers of flavors were bright and warming all at once. Service was excellent without being overbearing.

This spot is hands down one of my favorite restaurants in NYC. The food is incredible, rich, flavorful, and consistently delicious. The curry is perfectly creamy with just the right amount of spice, and the salads are fresh and full of flavor. But the dumplings‚Ä¶ OMG, easily my favorite part of the meal!

The service is fantastic, and their lunch combo is such a great deal. I tried the red curry, and it was absolutely divine. Can‚Äôt wait to go back!

I came here alone and it‚Äôs super cozy and comfy. All the staff are so kind and really care about the food and service. And the food‚Ä¶ oh my gosh‚Ä¶ it was so good I literally wiped the plate clean üòÇ If you‚Äôre craving Thai food, just stop thinking and come here!!

Try Malii Gramercy! We had the angel hair noodles with crispy pork belly‚Äîsuper flavorful. The crab meat fried rice was spot on, packed with jumbo crab chunks. Don‚Äôt skip the fried pork belly with spicy sriracha dip‚Äîso good.

Amazing Thai restaurant in the heart of Gramercy that has a cozy and light-hearted vibe. My friend and I came here for lunch on a Saturday and it was a good thing we made reservations because the place got packed pretty quickly.

The food was excellent!  We ordered the veggie spring rolls (accompanied with the lunch special) and the chive pancakes as our appetizer, which were lightly-fried and paired very nicely with the pancake sauce.  My friend ordered the noodles with vegetarian duck, and I ordered their famous crab fried rice.  Both were super fresh and perfectly-cooked.  I took my remaining dish home as a leftover and it still tasted awesome when I had it for dinner a few hours later.

For drinks, we ordered a Thai iced tea, lychee martini, and Mezcal sour.  They all tasted great ‚Äì not too sweet and with the perfect hint of an alcohol aftertaste for the cocktails.

All the servers were also friendly and helpful.

All in all, I highly recommend this spot for a delicious Thai dining experience in a fun atmosphere!

Stopped in here after my dentist appointment and was very happy with my decision. The inside was extremely clean and cozy - I really enjoyed the bird sconces. It was still happy hour, and they had $2 oysters which frankly I think is a kick ass deal. They came with Thai sauces, lemon, and crispy‚Äôs to put on top - they were big oysters too. Delicious. Thai iced tea was bomb, and so was the red curry with pork I got. Great meal, quick service and lovely staff. Total spent before tip was $37ü™Ω

Amazing food!! Probably now one of my favorite Thai places! Their Pad Thai was exceptional and I usually do not like pad thai as my main. Other dishes such as the red curry, and pad ke mao was also extremely flavorful and really good! Not your average Thai place since these dishes really showcased all the Thai spices and overall was extremely good, I would def. come back here to dine in or take out and try the other dishes and apps they have!

Good thai food! I feel like I struggle to find good thai food in the city, and this place really hit the spot with their pad see ew. The noodles were probably some of the softest flat noodles I've ever had.

I usually enjoy having some leftovers to take home from a thai restaurant, but I feel that the portions here are a little smaller, where I was satisfied with the meal, but there wasn't enough to take home as well.

Wow!! This place is sooo good! Mind blowing flavorful dishes and yummy drinks that pair well with the food. The crab fried rice and the crispy pork belly are definitely a must order! The yuzu margarita is delicious as well. Really great service and a nice modern atmosphere. Highly recommend!

Came here with my mom for dinner and had a wonderful experience. I chose this place primarily because of their tom yum with mixed seafood. Most places in New York only have shrimp/prawns in their tom yum. The soup was spicy, flavorful, and the seafood was fresh. We also got the oysters, which were a great size and also fresh. The last thing we got was chicken pad kee mao, which was great. The drinks were also amazing, we got the lychee martini and the yuzu margarita. The decor of the restaurant is also very modern and so was the cutlery and dinnerware, and made the experience even more enjoyable.

The food was amazing, we ate the Fall seasonal pumpkin fries which were light and delicious. The sauces in the garlic salmon and the crispy pork belly basil were seasoned very well. The vibes were also great with a popping atmosphere and excellent service. The service was also fast which we appreciated since we were running late to a concert. Glad we stumbled upon this place, will definitely come back.

Great place to eat something really tasty.  We just walked in, with no reservation and thankfully got a tabl. It was busy, almost all the tables were booked. A bit loud there, but the food were ready in 5 minutes after the order and it was fresh. We ordered Pad see ew and Tod Mun.

Had been here on a Friday. The place was packed and the seating was very cramped. We started off with litchi lemonade and lemon chicken. The lemonade was refreshing but a little too sweet. The lemon chicken was amazing, crispy fried chicken on a base of crispy leaves and lemon drizzle on top. Would highly recommend. We then got pad kee mao with chicken and panang curry. Both the dishes were absolutely delicious with huge portion sizes. Our order got mixed up with a beef pad kee mao but the waitress quickly changed it. Lovely decor and vibe.

Three of us had an excellent meal the other night:  pad Thai with wonderful shrimp, a superb roasted sea bass, and panang curry. Service was professional and responsive.  The restaurant was a bit noisy for us, but not terribly so.  The value is excellent - hard to believe they can offer that level of quality for that price in NYC.  Great experience!  Highly recommended!

Outstanding food and service! Malii's is my go-to-spot for takeout AND dine-in to spend time with family and friends. I've celebrated my birthday here too. Lucky to have them in the neighborhood.

Takeout is always quick and efficient even when the restaurant is crowded. There are Thai staples and unique family-style dishes; I recommend the Zabb Wings, Crab Fried Rice, Lemongrass Sea Bass, Steamed Sea Bass, Lychee Duck Curry, Pad See Ew, Red Curry and Mango Sticky Rice dessert made with Pandan Sticky Rice!!

This review was made in connection with a Toast promotion. #CommunityAppreciationWeek @toasttab
It was great place to try Thai Food, the food they have is packed with so much flavor. I‚Äôll definitely come again!

Location is convenient.Near work and schools.
The staff are friendly and attentive.
The food we ordered were tasty.

I have come to regularly frequent this restaurant for their very reasonably priced lunch menu, consistently delicious food and Thai iced tea which is always on point. I‚Äôve taken friends and colleagues here and it‚Äôs always a great experience. They also recently refreshed the decor which I think took their restaurant the extra mile. 5 stars across the board!
All of the food my family ordered was amazing.

Malii Gramercy is a great spot for flavorful, well-balanced Thai food in a relaxed setting. The dishes are fresh, vibrant, and beautifully presented‚Äîthe pad thai and green curry stand out, packed with authentic flavor and just the right spice. The portions are generous, and everything tastes clean and thoughtfully made. The staff are friendly and attentive, and the space has a calm, modern vibe that makes it perfect for both a casual meal or a cozy dinner out. A solid choice for anyone craving quality Thai food done right.

Fortunately there are pics of the dishes. Otherwise one would be lost. The food was very good. Although too spicy. The place is loud. And after 45 minutes they asked us to leave because they wanted the table for other guests. An absolute no no.

Delicious Thai food, large portions, lychee mocktail. What more could I ask for from a Thai place? We came at 5pm and it wasn‚Äôt too busy. When we left it started to pick up a bit. Curry puffs were delicious. I had the khao soi, friend had some crispy seafood dish. It was all tasty

This place is perfect for a date or catching up with friends. The atmosphere is lovely, and the food and service are top-notch. We picked it because it was convenient, and we were so happy we did. Definitely one of the best Thai spots around. You have to try the tod mun and crab fried rice. We‚Äôll be back for sure to try more dishes!

Friendly atmosphere, attentive staff, good food.
The Shrimp Pad Thai was excellent, so was the lime chicken if a bit too copious for an appetizer. I was full! I tried the featured mango fizz cocktail which was yummy.
From looking around at other diners, I think the lunch special is a good deal.
The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that I felt rushed out the door; I was barely finished when the server brought the machine over for me to pay.

I was highly impressed by this establishment. I went with two friends and we shared the below:

Lemongrass Sea Bass - 10/10
Crab Fried Rice - 10/10
Pad Thai Boran - 8/10
Thai Iced Tea - 8/10
Thai Iced Tea (w/ Oat Milk substitute) - 9/10 for non-dairy accomodation

The restaurant was also impressive otherwise:
Service - 9/10
Ambiance - 8/10 for price range and vs comparative set in the area
Location - 8/10 not as accessible and a short walk from major transportation options
Restroom: 8/10 clean, paper towels for drying hands,  dimly lit

Overall highly recommend and I'll be back again!

Malii Gramercy feels like an actual Gem find. I chose this place to try because of restaurant week 2024 and needless to say, I will be coming back here in my own time.
It is located in the heart of gramercy and close to stuy town.
The inside felt modern-rustic and the outside of the building looked minimalistic and unsuspecting.
The waitress sat us down immediately. I went at exactly 11:30AM so they were still setting up, but some of party was late anyways so she gave us some time while preparing the area.
The furniture inside were clean and well-maintained.
The food, was fire (I have no other words to describe it in taste and physical feeling)
It had a nice kick to it. They have a huge selection for restaurant week 2024 and it was all $30 per person for lunch. With tip and tax, it came to about $40 per person.

I got the lime fried chicken and the ribs. I would 100% recommend this place to my friends and families.

**note it was too cold inside, the NYC weather was hovering around 75F at the time and people were wearing shorts and they had the AC blasting. They were kind of enough to turn it off when I had asked them to.

This is our favorite spot with my churchmates. After our daily church visit we stop by here to eat and gather. We have our favorites in the menu - Crab fried rice, Vermicelli shrimp noodle and pork belly appetizer matched up with the Thai iced tea soooo gooooood. We usually come here every month with the same dishes we usually order. Shoutout to Hero, Anne T, Sohi & Joanne

Cathelyne

Would 100% recommend if you are in the area! Such great and unique thai dishes. They had your classics (like the chicken pad thai) but also had some fun dishes like the crab fried rice pictured below. We started with cocktails (the moscow mules and margs) which were excellent! And then for an appetizer we got the shrimp and pork steamed dumplings. A bit bummed they came with 5 and not 6 so we could split them evenly, but they were very tasty. We also got the crispy pork belly which had a delicious basil sauce.

Service was good, vibes were good. Would come back again.

this spot is easily one of my favorite thai spots in manhattan. the interior is gorgeous and the staff are all super friendly and attentive. I loved every dish but you MUST order their thai tea sizzling roti. so unique and your taste buds will thank you

100 stars for the service. We ordered a dish that was not what we expected for the pictures and the waiter was kind enough to switch it out for us. Friendly and attentive service, and the food was really, really, good! The duck dish- yuuuummm! Will be back!

The restaurant was really nice. Such a nice vibe and it felt very welcoming. The servers were very attentive and I always appreciate good service. I went in with a friend and we shared all of our food.

I order the Mule cocktail. It was very refreshing but it lacked some punch. It could have used a touch more spirit but I wasn't there for the drinks so it's okay.

I wasn't too thrilled with the appetizers. They looked very pretty and are very instagrammable but they lacked flavor. It kinda made us worried that the whole meal was going to be bland. The Duck Bun needed more sauce in it and the Branzino Fresh Rolls were hard to eat and flavorless without the side sauce. Maybe that's the way they're supposed to be enjoyed but I wasn't the biggest fan. Not terrible.

For our entrees, we were going to be adventurous and try something we've never had before but after the apps, we wanted to get something we were used to. We ordered the Squid Pad Thai, the Panang Curry and for the wild card, the went with the Basil Crispy Pork Belly. Those dishes were all excellent. A complete different experience from the apps. The flavors, the textures, the plating, everything went right with the entrees. I would possibly go back again to try the dishes we originally planned on getting like the Lychee Duck Curry.
The food is very delicious. It is a restaurant worth trying. I will come again next time.

We ordered the duck rolls, pad see ew, green curry, and pineapple fried rice. For dessert we got their fried ice cream and mango sticky rice.

I thought the green curry and pineapple friend rice were just ok. The rest were good.

I usually go to SPICE, but I was in the area and decided to give this place a try. Upon entry the look and feel of the location is visually pleasing. Kudos to whomever decorated the place because it's a very artistic. The staff was very welcoming and greeted us immediately, took our orders and it came out in a timely manner. Didn't have to wait long at all. And the food was AMAZINGGGG.. everyone REALLY enjoyed their meals. The drinks weren't watered, and it give us a buzz. This place definitely deserves checking out. It's very intimate and cozy, not for a huge crowd. I'm sure you'll like the experience.

Overall rating: 4.8

Absolutely love this place, completely underrated and more people should go here! I went for restaurant week with my friend and it was totally worth it. We had the following:

- mussels: 6/5 so good!
- shrimp lollipop: 4/5 more of a shrimp croquette and was good, only 2.
- ribs: 4/5 the ribs were sooo spicy!! Like be prepared spicy.
- crab curry: 4/5 there was a pepper in the dish that almost burned my mouth of bc it was so spicy so just be prepared. The crab was good, but the star of the show was definitely the curry!

The service was amazing and I love the atmosphere of the restaurant. Not too loud, super chill, and gorgeously decorated.

Highly recommend!
